recommendations: Initiate hemodynamic stabilization with fluid resuscitation and/or vasopressors to achieve SBP >90 mmHg and MAP >65 mmHg prior to contrast administration.
Administer a reduced contrast volume of 0.8-1.0 mL/kg (approximately 50-70 mL) using low-osmolar or iso-osmolar iodinated contrast.
Implement a comprehensive renal protection protocol including pre- and post-hydration with isotonic saline.
Consider a Ventilation-Perfusion (V/Q) scan if hemodynamic goals cannot be met or the patient remains unstable.

protocol_selection.name: CT Pulmonary Angiography (Chest CTA for PE)
protocol_selection.description: CT angiography timed for pulmonary arterial phase (6–13 sec post-contrast) to evaluate pulmonary arteries for embolism. Modified contrast volume and hydration protocols are required.
protocol_selection.contrast_dose: Modified weight-based; ~0.8–1.0 mL/kg (approx. 50–70 mL) iodinated contrast (300 mg I/mL); follow ACR Manual and institutional guidelines for renal impairment and hypotension.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Requires pre-hydration, reduced contrast volume, and post-hydration. Hemodynamic stabilization is mandatory prior to contrast administration. eGFR of 59 mL/min/1.73m² and hypotension are significant risk factors.

protocol_selection.name: Ventilation-Perfusion (V/Q) Scan
indications: alternative to CTPA in renal impairment
alternative to CTPA in contrast allergy
protocol_selection.description: Radiopharmaceutical study to assess for pulmonary embolism by imaging ventilation and perfusion in the lungs. Preferred modality for patients with significant contraindications to iodinated contrast agents.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: No iodinated contrast is used, making it a safe alternative for patients with renal impairment or hypotension where contrast-enhanced CT is contraindicated or high-risk.
